result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheadrick Anthony Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.

records.addlTxt: 9:13 AM  Defendant Sheadrick Anthony Williams appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional Inst.  Attorney Melissa Anne Frost appeared by video for Sheadrick Anthony Williams.  Attorney Emmeline Lee in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters guilty plea to count 1, 4 and 6.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2, 3 and 5 dismissed and read in.  Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 2 years 6 months confinement and 3 years extended supervision concurrent with any sentence currently serving.  Defendant to complete any assessment, treatment and counseling required.  DOC collect costs.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol. Credit for 121 days.  Defendant is eligible for programs.  Felony warnings given. NOTE - Count 6 is misdemeanor and Judge Wood orders 2 years confinement only.
